intro: Sericographis mohintli, commonly known as the Mohintli sericograph, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface, adapted to its arid environment. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
